conversations.content: Once upon a time, long, looong ago... (Okay, it wasn't THAT long ago, but whatever.) One fated day, out in the woods, I met Luccy.
I was sobbing my eyes out, having lost my mom and dad, and he swooped in to save me. That's when love struck like a lightning bolt! I just knew we were destined to be together.
Sure, fate conspired to keep us apart for some time after that, but I never stopped searching for him...until, at long last, we were reunited! And on that special day, he had this to say:
＂Come and live with me in my castle.＂  SQUEEEEE! OHHH EMMM GEEE! I CAN'T EVEN! LITERALLY! OR FIGURATIVELY!
Everything was going so smoothly it had me hyperventilating! I was living under the same roof as my love! And as those happy days went on, the event I'd been waiting for was finally upon us.
Yes... Valentine's Day had come at last! There'd be gifts and dates and professions of undying love! Our bond would grow even deeper! So, to get things started...
LUCCY! Here you go: a super-special Valentine's Day present, from me to you!
Yeaaah, uh... I'm not really sure where to even start with you this time.
Let's go with, ＂What are you wearing?＂ Also, you mentioned a present, but you're empty-handed. What gives?
Awww, silly Luccy! This dress is both the gift box AND the big ol' bow on top!
And your present is...little ol' me!
Did I surprise you? Sorry if this is an eensy-weensy bit sudden!
Back up a sec. What's happening? Better yet, WHY'S it happening?
Because it's Valentine's, silly! Don't you wanna take our love to the next level?
That's why I thought of the perfect present. When I asked myself what I most wanted to give you, the answer was simple: me!
You say that, but you completely lost me. Who the heck's ever heard of giving a person as a present, anyway?
I dunnooo, but I'm all yours now, Luccy. Oop, joy's flooding out of my nose like a waterfall!
Chelsea, that's blood. And hey, are you even listening to me? Wait. Dumb question. Of course you're not.
Eee hee hee! Now that I'm one of your belongings, I get to come home with you!
I've gotta pick out the best vantage spot for maximum Luccy-gazing. How about... here? Ooh, or maybe here? No, wait, here!
I'll be right at your bedside so I can watch you sleep aaaaall night long!
Wha—hey! Don't go building a nest outta my pillows. I use those to sleep 'n stuff!
Oops! Sorry, Luccy. Am I in the way? I'll move so I'm across from the door, then!
Eeeee hee hee hee hee hee!
I give up. She's even more, uh... ＂passionate＂ than usual today.
The next day...
I'm off on patrol, Cleo!
Thank you, Luca. Do you have everything with you? You always take off in such a hurry that I worry you'll forget something.
Aw, I'm fine! Got my bow, plenty of arrows, and even a buncha apples to snack on. I'm not leaving anything—
BZZZT! You're forgetting something VERY important!
Huh? Like what?
Like ME, silly! It's imperative that you keep me on your person at all times.
Wow, yeah, completely slipped my mind... Maybe because that's NOT HAPPENING!
*sigh* But of course you came with me anyway.
Tee hee! I won't stand for you leaving home without me, mister!
Look, how am I supposed to patrol properly with you clinging to me like some kinda land-barnacle? I've gotta move, y'know!
Wait up, Luccy! If you go too far, someone's liable to come scoop me up and drop me at the lost-and-found!
If only. Now c'mon, I'm trying to walk here! Quit goofing around and let's go.
You make the whole ＂gruff, bossy hubby＂ thing work for you, Luccy. Hee hee. Just lead the way and I shall follow!
PLEASE. GET. OFF. OF. ME.
Phew. Finally finished my patrol. Where'd my number one fan run off to?
Welcome home, Luccy!
HOLY...! How are you back in my room before me?
Why, because I'm yours, silly! It's only natural for me to be here.
Chelsea. Please. Can we drop this whole bit?
What EVER could you mean?
About you being my present, or some object that ＂belongs＂ to me.
You're a grown woman, Chelsea. People aren't commodities to own.
Awww, but Luccy... What am I supposed to give you for Valentine's Day, then?
I don't care, as long as it's something normal! Emphasis on ＂thing.＂
A thing... So that's what you want.
Right. And that does NOT include you. I'm sure anything you pick out will be great.
That's so sweet, Luccy. Okay! I'll keep brainstorming the perfect present, then.
*mumble mumble grumble rumble...* *mumble grumble rumble mumble...* Nnnnngrrrgh...
I can't sleep! The more I think about what I wanna give Luccy, the more ideas come to mind.
I can't pick only one. I wish I could just...give him all of them.
Waaait a second. Silly me. That's EXACTLY what I'll do!
Eee hee hee, Valentine's Day is juuust getting started. We're for SURE going on a date and pledging our eternal love.
But first, I'll make my feelings clear with a whole heap of presents. Prepare to be positively showered with affection, Luccy!
Lots and lots and lots and lots and lots and LOTS and LOTS and LOTS and LOTS and LOTS AND LOTS AND LOTS AND LOTS of it!
It'll be less a shower of affection... and more of a HURRICANE! Hee hee!
Ta-dah! Here's your present, Luccy. Spoiler: it's a sweater!
It's got your name on it...AND mine! I tried to make it really classy. Artistic-like, you know?
Ta-daaah! Here's your gift for today, Luccy. I drew our storybook love into a literal storybook!
It starts with our meeting and goes all the way up to when we're buried side-by-side in a shared grave! Oops, more spoilers!
Ta-daaaaah! Here's today's haul, Luccy! The armoire in your room was getting old, so I had a new one custom-built for you!
Too big? Don't be silly! With all our kids on the way, we'll need at LEAST this much storage to keep everything squared away.
*siiiiiiigh*
(Well, Chelsea DID listen to me about only giving inanimate objects as presents...)
(But it's EVERY. SINGLE. DAY. And each one's more expensive and labor-intensive than the last.)
(I can tell she's put a ton of thought into each and every one, but...that's kinda the problem. It's terrifying.)
(I keep looking over my shoulder, bracing for the next ＂token of affection.＂)
LUCCY!
Eagh! She's back again! I've gotta hide!
Hmmmmm? Are you out and about? Luuuccy! Oh, Luuuuuccy!
(Hold your breath... Erase your presence... Just another minute, and she'll—)
*sniff* *sniff* *sniffffff* Target acquired.
I know you're iiiiin there, Luccy! Open the door. Open the door, sweetie. Open it. Open the door OPEN THE DOOR—
*gasp* Hrk... I'm not! I'm not here!
I know what's going on here, Luccy. The door's stuck and you're trapped inside. But don't you worry...
I'll pry it open with my crowbar of love.
Chelsea?! GAH! The door's in splinters!
There we go, Luccy. I knew you were in here, silly.
Your Chelsea is riiiight here!
IN ILIA'S NAME I PRAY, SPARE MEEE!
*sigh...*
What's wrong, Chelsea?
Oh! Sarisse. Well, it's about yesterday...
—and then he let out the CUTEST blood- curdling scream and fainted on the spot.
I see. Luca can be so insensitive at times! What kinda dunderhead freaks out when someone's only trying to give you a gift?
I wanted to make him happy, not scared...
Hmmm... So you're trying to think of a present that'll brighten his spirits, huh?
Maybe something normal would work best. He's a pretty simple-minded guy.
What about making some food for him? Like, some sweets would make an easy gift.
You think? I'd been avoiding food, seeing as I already make him meals all the time.
No need to worry about that. There's no way a gift that timeless'll go over his head!
If you think Luccy will love it, then I'm in.
Great! Mind if I join you in the kitchen? Melsa and I are doing a sweets exchange!
You're a total cooking whiz, so I'd love to have you there to help if I get stuck.
You really want to bake with me?!
(Oh gosh, I'm freaking out! But once Luccy and I are married, she'll be my little sis...)
Y'know? I'd love to help, Sarisse! Both today, and for many, MANY years to come.
Uh... Okay? As long as you don't mind!
Now, what to make... Got anything in mind yet, Chelsea?
I'm going with apple pie! Luccy just LOVES apples.
Aha ha ha! I figured you'd say that. His taste buds are gonna be in heaven.
Now, as for me... I should probably make something holiday-appropriate.
The problem is, I'm just not that familiar with Valentine's Day. It's a human thing.
How about, um... Rose cookies?
Roses are a traditional Valentine's gift, so I think that should be plenty suitable.
Huh! Great idea, Chelsea! I knew you were the right girl to ask about this kinda stuff.
Oh, uh... Gosh! Ha ha. You're making me blush. Glad I could help!
For a sylvan, you sure are an expert on this human holiday.
Yeah, I guess so. When I was little, I lived with my mom and dad in a human village, see.
We used to give each other Valentine's presents every year—as a family.
That's really sweet. You must have so many happy holiday memories, then.
Yeah. It's a special day for me. That's why I really wanna make it memorable for Luccy, too.
Awww, my brother is SO spoiled. Right— let's cram all our love into these suckers!
And...done! Ha ha! I hope Melsa likes it.
How'd your apple pie come out? Whoa, that looks amazing! It's got a perfectly golden crust, and that smell? HEAVENLY.
No... It's a failure.
Huh?
It's burned here and there. Plus, the dome didn't rise high enough.
Valentine's Day is special. The pie has to be special, too!
Er, Chelsea...? Don't tell me you're going to start again from scratch?
Another dud. The ratio of apple filling to crust was totally skewed.
You're starting over AGAIN? But it looks delicious...
Nope... This one's flawed too. Too much cinnamon this time.
You DO know it's almost midnight, right? How many pies have you gone through?
Another-nother-nother-nother-nother dud... One more time!
Zzz...zzz...
I'll keep going till I've got the perfect apple pie. No matter how many tries it takes.
The next morning...
Another dud... A failure... One more... Just one more...try... *mumble*
*yaaawn* Mmm, something sure smells good. What's cookin'?
Whoa! It's apple pies as far as the eye can see! Talk about a breakfast buffet. Let's have a taste... *HOMPH!*
GYAAAH! LUCCY, NO! You can't eat that! It's not... It's not...!
It has a whole half-pinch too much sugar, the fire was two kindling twigs too hot, and the egg wash only hit 99.9%! It's not food!
Mm? This... This is AMAZING!
Bwuh?
Oh, hey, Chelsea. Did you bake this? Girl, you could WEAPONIZE pie this good!
You... You like it? You're happy, Luccy? Even though my pie is totally garbage-tier?
What are you talking about? This is a fantastic present. I love it.
(And unlike all the others, I don't feel a crushing weight bearing down on me...but that's a little hard to say to her face.)
Eee... EEE HEE HEE HEE HEE! This is great. Stupendous, even!
My Luccy's a bona fide pie-niac! I just have to bake until the cows come home!
Sorry it took me this long to figure out what you wanted, sweetie. Thank you, Sarisse! Thank you, Valentine's Day!
From now on, I'll bake you desserts for all three meals, plus afternoon and midnight snacks!
Ooh, I'd better get started planting the apple orchard for next year! The wheat field for the flour I'll need, too.
Uh, you REALLY don't have to do all that.
EeE HeE hEe HeE! Eventually, your entire diet will consist of nothing but food I've lovingly grown from the ground up!
Just you wait, Luccy!
Ah, yes. There's that old, familiar terror setting in again.
Tee hee... Eeeee hee hee hee hee...
This apple pie is insanely good!
I've had Luccy's smile replaying on endless loop in my head ever since!  It's enough to make a girl drool!
No, this is more than just good, Chelsea...
This is more than an apple pie. It's an edible declaration of your love.
And I'm accepting each and every bite. Chelsea, bake me one of these every day for the rest of our lives together!
Thus did a parade of sweets grace the couple's table every day, their love fuller than their bellies at dinnertime...
Then came the children. First one, then two, three... Before they knew it, the pitter- patter of twenty tiny feet filled their home!
A home warmed by a glowing hearth. A huge yard for teaching the kids archery. And a gigantic, fluffy, white dog as a pet!
EEEEEEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE!
Married! We have to get married!
So nice to have a clear vision of my future. Now, for tomorrow's Valentine's present—
Gold is the classic choice for wedding and engagement jewelry, though many younger people choose silver as well.
Yes, yes, I see... Very interesting.
They're all so lovely! It just isn't a wedding without a shiny pair of matching earrings. I need to pick out the very best for us!
Oh, yes! Matching earrings are a powerful symbol of your eternal union—proof of a sylvan spouse's bond! Do take your time.
Ah, but is your partner not with you today to help you choose?
Nope! My Luccy's just too popular. He's always in high demand. That's why I try to take care of these things for him.
Awww! He's so lucky to have you. I'm sure you'll enjoy a wonderful partnership together.
You think?! Heh. Hee hee hee... You flatter me. I'll try my absolute best!
Now, have you made your decision?
I've gotta say, nothing draws my eye quite like the bling here. It'll shine a guiding light on the path of matrimony before us!
And then... I'd also like your best piece that's infused with the power of love!
Infused with the...what of what, miss?
Y'know, like if Luccy gets hurt in battle and I pray to the heavens and his earring picks up my prayer and starts glowing and the
power of my love is like ZWING! and heals his wounds miraculously and he's all like WOW! or if the two of us get split up, but
only in the geographic sense because we'll never get split up relationship-wise but the rings would light up with the power of love
and guide us back to each other's arms so basically a pair of earrings that will get us through any and all obstacles forever!
I'm afraid we don't have anything quite so, erm...magical in stock.
It's not magic; it's the whole key to our happy future that I absolutely cannot live without and will fully throw a fit if I can't get, thanks!
Uhhh... Um... I could introduce you to a skilled goldsmith who can apply  protective properties?
The northern woods are home to a legendary artisan with a deep knowledge of magic. He might be able to make—
Say no more. I'm on the case!
Honestly, though, I wouldn't recommend it. His skill is rivaled only by his legendary temper. He refuses our commissions and—
Er... Miss?
So that's what I want. Make it, please!
*sigh* Hold your horses, girl. I don't just go hammering out accessories for any lovesick fool who drops by.
Yes, my enchanted artifacts are quite powerful. But that's precisely why I can't casually dole them out to strangers.
Don't worry! There's nothing casual about the love between me and Luccy!
That... That isn't my point. Now, listen—
Then what IS your point? Our love stands on the bedrock of two iron wills! Frankly, it's offensive you'd suggest otherwise.
Yes, and I'm saying that's not the... Look. Real love is about carving open your own path together. You can't just buy a magic—
That's exactly what I'm doing: carving a path! By any means necessary. Hee hee.
I'm sure you'll understand if you just hear me out. Now, listen while I extol the strength of our love!
First, there's all of Luccy's best traits. He's bright and cheery and super popular and nice to everyone and he's a dreamer and—
—which is why I knew then and there! Forever being his steadfast companion is my calling. My role. My destiny!
Girl, I... Fine. You know what? Fine.
Huh? But I have four or five more hours of prepared material (plus visual aids!) ready to go! Here, I'll—
MERCY! Please, no! I'll make them! Anything you want! Just please, spare me!
Here... They're done. Take 'em and go.
Wooow, they're SOOO pretty! A pair of magic earrings to protect our fated love...
More like ＂lightly enchanted.＂ At the end of the day, no trinket will keep your love alive. That's your job.
Awww, Mr. Craftsman Guy...! I promise you we'll live happily ever after!
I finally got my hands on the symbols of our love. Sit tight, Luccy. I'm on my way!
Hey. You catch that dame? Just walked out of the stubborn old goat's workshop with some kinda jewelry.
You serious? The stingy old coot's pieces all go for a fortune at market.
And there went one with a skinny, defenseless little waif of a girl... Keh heh heh. It's time for a shakedown.
*huff...* *pant...* Finally made it over the mountain. Not long now till I'm back at Luccy's side.
Whoa there, lass. That's as far as you go.
Aaah!
Who are you?
Just a few friendly fellas what followed you out here to relieve you of those little trinkets you got.
What, these earrings?
The very same, aye. Made by the old craftsman what used to work for the royal family, weren't they?
Wouldn't be right, you keepin' such treasures all to yerself, now would it? Let's have 'em here, love.
No way. These represent my upcoming marriage to Luccy.
So you're to be wed, eh? That's right—you forest-dwellers trade earrings at the altar.
You're young to marry yet, lass. Cool your heels and consider those baubles a charitable donation. Or...
We can do this rough-like.
So you plan on taking them by force, then?
Well... I'm still not handing them over. They're part of my special Valentine's plan to live happily ever after with Luccy!
You don't say? Thing is, it's awful hard to live happily ever after...if you stop livin'!
Eeagh! No! Stop!
Hyeh heh heh. Scared to die, girl? Then hand 'em over, and do it fast!
Better do as he says. What kinda idiot blathers on about weddings and holidays with a blade to her throat?
Besides, you're puttin' yourself in the poorhouse givin' valuables away to some loverboy. Might as well toss 'em by the roadside at that point!
You don't give presents because it turns you a profit. You do it to show the love you carry in your heart.
Get a load of this dunce, boys. Gah ha ha! That hippity-hoppity head fulla Valentine's fluff is about to be lying in the dirt!
Aaah!
Last chance, girl! Give 'em here!
*pant* No... Never...
Getting to spend Valentine's Day with you and your mother makes it the happiest day of my life, year after year.
One day, when you're all grown up, you can celebrate it by showering the person YOU love with presents, Chelsea.
It's not...just fluff...
Say again? You got rocks for brains, or—
Spending Valentine's with the one you love makes it the happiest day of your life...
So I'm spending it with Luccy. This year, and the year after, and the year after that.
I'll give him so many presents, he'll be the happiest boy in the whole wide world.
Which means these earrings are Luccy's happiness. And anyone who gets in the way of Luccy's happiness...
GWARGH?!
What?! How'd she just—
HURK!
I'll delete you all... Delete... Delete... DELETE!
Mercy... I'm beggin' ya!
GYAAAAAGH!
*pant...* *pant...*
That takes care of those nasty obstacles. I'll be home soon, Luccy. Wait for me...
*pant...* *pant...* Luccy... Luccy...
LUUUCCYYY!
Huh? Whoa—Chelsea?! What's wrong?
Hm? Oh, sorry! Did I worry you? I know today's present is a bit later than usual.
That's not what I meant! You're bleeding! What in the world happened to you?
Oh, this? I was on my way over with your gift when some silly bandits held me up.
No need to worry, though! I didn't let them lay a finger on it.
The GIFT is fine? Chelsea, you're...! Ugh, why do you always do this?!
Please take it, Luccy. This is my way of saying—
Enough of this, Chelsea!
Muh...?
Why would you risk your life over this? Did you really think that would make me happy?!
Luccy? I'm... I'm sorry...
But it's Valentine's Day, and I tried my best to show you how I feel, so—
Did I ever ask you for presents? Did I say you had to try your best at ANYTHING for my sake?
Well, no, but I want you to be happy, so I'll do whatever it takes to make that—
＂Whatever it takes＂? Just stop it. Seriously.
If you're going to keep doing things like  this, I never want another present from you! EVER!
You don't...want any more presents from me. Never, ever, ever, huh?
Hee hee... Okay.
I understand, Luccy. I'll do as you ask.
I'll stop with the presents. So, please...
Look, Chelsea. I'm sorry I yelled. But I'm being dead serious when I say I'd be much happier if you'd stop with all the gifts.
*mumble mumble...*
Valentine's Day with the one I love... My happy future... Gifts given with all my heart...
If he doesn't want any of that...
Heh heh... Aha ha ha ha...
Out on patrol, Luca? 'Preciate it! Oh, is Chelsea not with you today?
You two've been joined at the hip ever since Valentine's Day.
We, uh, kinda got into it yesterday...
Lover's quarrel, huh?
It's not like that, man. I just... I might've been a little harsh on her.
But I don't want her risking her neck just to get me some present, and if you don't talk to her bluntly, she never listens.
Anyway, what's done is done. It had to be said.
Uh-huh. Well, if you think ya had to, ya had to. You wanna go a couple rounds? Knock you right outta that funk?
Ooh, great idea! It's been too long. All righty. Let's rumble!
Hnnngh... Ahhh! I'm stiff as a board after all that sparring. Hope my bed's ready for the belly flop of the centur—
Welcome back, Luccy!
Gah! Chelsea? Uhhh... What brings you here?
And why is my room A DISASTER AREA?!
Oh, this? You said you didn't want any of my presents, so I'm disposing of them.
Every single gift I gave you for Valentine's Day was just in your way, Luccy.
And anything in my Luccy's way has to be deleted. Delete... Delete... Delete! Aha ha... AHA HA HA HA HA HA HA!
Hooold on, Chelsea! Chill out!
Is this about what I said yesterday? Look, I didn't mean I don't want all the stuff you gave me; I only—
You don't have to explain anything, Luccy. You always sacrifice yourself for others. But what you don't want, you don't want!
And anything my Luccy doesn't want gets DE-LE-TED!
Er, Chelsea? Chelsea! Where are you going?! Wait!
And one...two... BURN IT ALL!
*huff...* *pant...* Chelsea! Wait, you gave me that! Don't burn it!
Why not, sweetie? If you don't need it, then neither does this world.
All those fun Valentine's memories... All those happy Valentine's dreams... They're aaaaall gone now.
But that's just fine. If it's going to get in the way of my Luccy loving me, Valentine's Day can rot in the gutter and DIE!
Don't say that! There's nothing wrong with feeling sentimental about a holiday.
Nobody's telling you not to. I'M certainly not telling you not to!
But that's the thing, Luccy. If you hate it, it isn't fun for me at all. That's why I'm reducing it all to ash!
Chelsea... Everything I say to you truly goes in one ear and out the other, huh?
Well, I'm not letting it slide. Not anymore. I'm about two seconds away from going FULL LUCA SMASH!
You're...mad?
Damn right I'm mad. I'm not just gonna sit here and watch you trample your own feelings right in front of me!
PLEASE. Just listen to me for once. Actually listen. What I said yesterday...
I meant that I don't want a present from you that causes you to come home bruised and battered!
I'm not telling you I hate presents. I hate seeing you go too far. That's it. That's all. I don't want to see you get hurt, Chelsea.
But...sometimes you have to go just a little bit crazy to really show how you fee—
Is that what love is to you—madness?! Obsession? Rare, expensive gifts? NO!
Your feelings shouldn't come wrapped up in a box.
Your feelings are inside you, Chelsea. In your heart!
That's all I need from you. Okay? That's enough for me!
Luccy...!
Am I getting through to you? Those are MY feelings. Did they get across okay?
Yeah... I'm sorry, Luccy.
I love you SO much, but...I wasn't really listening to what you were telling me.
I completely missed how kind you were being.
Gah! HOT! Maybe don't glomp me with a lit torch in your hands!
Luccy, Luccy, LUCCYYYYY!
AUGH, STOP! IT BURNS! Gimme that, you dang lunatic!
Oop—
Ah. Whoopsie, I dropped it.
GAAAAAAAH!
Er... Your Highness, there's been a minor conflagration in the courtyard.
What in the world happened?
Yes, well. It seems Chelsea was trying to burn some refuse there...
She was? What's the damage?
Just some scorched grass, thankfully. It was just a small blaze, quickly contained. Shall we make a formal reprimand?
If no harm came from it, there's no need. Honestly, something of this scale hardly surprises me at this point.
If I yelled every time someone set the yard aflame with magic or blew it up with some ancient weapon, I'd go hoarse.
You...have a point. Understood. Then I'll take no further action.
Luccy! Say, ＂Aaaaah!＂
Aah.
How does today's apple pie taste, on a scale of ＂one＂ to ＂nummy＂?
Life-changing.
Yaaay! Luccy complimented my baking again!
Tee hee hee... Okay, one more bite, then! ＂Aaaaah!＂
Aah.
EEEEE HEE HEE hee hee!
(There's no better present I can give Luccy than my feelings.)
(And that's something I can give him every day—not just on Valentine's!)
(I hope you've got room for a whole lot more, my sweet.)
('Cause I've got so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, so, SO, SO, SO, SO, SO, SO, SO, SO, SO...)
SOOOOOOOOOOO much more to give!
